definition:
The unit disk in the complex plane, denoted $\Delta$, is defined as
$\{ z \in {\mathbb C}: |z| < 1 \}$. The unit circle, denoted
$\partial\Delta$ or $S^1$ is the boundary
$\{z \in {\mathbb C}: |z|=1 \}$ of the unit disk $\Delta$. Every element
$z \in \partial\Delta$ can be written as $z=e^{i \theta}$ for some real
value of $\theta$.
